body: 近期会修复一下 SVG 文字相关的问题

Hi @alex2wong. Thanks for the very detailed explanation.

The components are designed to be decoupled and don't know the exists of each other. We are planning to add a separate layout module to adjust all the components' position and size to avoid the overlap. It needs the default value of `left/top/right/bottom` to be changed and may cause breaking change. So we put it in the 5.0 roadmap.

Currently, I'm afraid the easiest way is still letting developers configure `grid.top` to 0 if there is only one grid component on the chart :)

Thank you. The integration site I was using has the english version labeled as "tiled." I thought that would show each line on different graph or needed special data to activate, as its non-functional in the initial view.

I think making the stack toggle between stack and unstack would be more discoverable. If that's not the direction you want to go, I'd suggest translating unstack icon to "un-stack" instead of "tiled".

Sorry, but please ask how-to questions on Stack Overflow or segmentfault（中文）. You may also send an email about your question to dev@echarts.apache.org if you like.
 
Here's why:
 
Maintaining open source projects, especially popular ones, is hard work. As ECharts's user base has grown, we are getting more and more usage questions, bug reports, feature requests and pull requests every single day.
 
As a free and open source project, ECharts also has limited maintainer bandwidth. That means the only way to ensure the project's sustainability is to:
  
Prioritize more concrete work (bug fixes and new features);
 
Improve issue triaging efficiency.
  
For (1), we have decided to use the GitHub issue lists exclusively for work that has well-defined, actionable goals. Questions and open ended discussions should be posted to mediums that are better suited for them.
 
For (2), we have found that issues that do not provide proper information upfront usually results in terribly inefficient back-and-forth communication just to extract the basic information needed for actual triaging. This is exactly why we have created this app: to ensure that every issue is created with the necessary information, and to save time on both sides.
 
—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

`radiusAxis` is for bar/line charts in polar system, which is not for radar charts. We do not support log axis for radar axis (actually, there is no such thing as radar axis).

If you do need such a feature, I can set this issue to be a feature request. You are encouraged to making a pull request for this feature, and we can give you some advice on how to implement if you are interested in it.

最新发现，6 plus下，container宽度达到4000px，就会白屏
https://echarts.apache.org/zh/option.html#xAxis.boundaryGap

4000px 在 2 倍 dpi 的情况下，宽度有 8000 了，这个内存很可能吃不消。
建议使用 dataZoom 之类的方法实现滚动 https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html?c=x88x_kzcqy
或者使用 SVG 对内存消耗更少：https://echarts.apache.org/zh/tutorial.html#使用%20Canvas%20或者%20SVG%20渲染

@zifix Great!
@100pah Please give some advice on how to make this possible.

Hi @zifix, really appreciate your passion!

In ECharts, axis type like `'log'` is abstracted as [Scale](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/src/scale/Scale.js). There are different kinds of scales:

+ Ordinal
+ Interval
+ Log
+ Time

Ordinal scale and interval scale are the most commonly used. Ordinal is for category data, while the interval is for the `number` like data. 

We fixed the scale to be `interval` in the radar chart. https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/src/coord/radar/Radar.js#L43 But as you mentioned. It's better to support `log` scale.

About how to create the `scale` from the given option. https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/src/coord/axisHelper.js#L248 may be an example you can reference.

Please let us know if you have any more questions. Looking forward to your fix:)

@GEMINI5516 Hi, I've added unit tests for this function. 
Please pull from master and run the unit tests of `test/ut/ut.html` before making a pull request. You may comment the files other than `number.js` in `test/ut/ut.js` to only test the number util.

This issue is scheduled in [v4.5.0](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/milestone/14), which closes for testing on 25th Oct. If you don't have time for it, please let me know in advance.
Please comment here if you have any questions.
